title: COVID-19 Vaccine Finder | COVID19
cleaned_text: COVID-19 Vaccine Finder COVID-19 vaccines are widely available throughout the city, including at doctors' offices, hospitals, pharmacies, community health centers, City-operated clinics, pop-up locations, and other special events. All COVID-19 vaccines are offered at no cost, regardless of ability to pay or immigration status. No government ID or insurance is required. Chicago COVID-19 Vaccination Finder *This map includes select locations offering COVID-19 vaccination in Chicago. This map does not provide an exhaustive list of all providers currently offering COVID-19 vaccines. Many providers are not listed on the map because they are providing vaccines only to to their current patients. Check the details associated with each provider prior to calling or showing up at the office or pharmacy. Providers - Chicagoans are encouraged to first reach out to their medical home. Hundreds of health care providers are currently offering COVID-19 vaccines, including primary care providers, health clinics, and hospitals. - If you have insurance but do not have a primary care provider, please check with your insurance company for a list of providers accepting new patients. If you do not have insurance, one option is to enroll with one of Chicago's many Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs). Download the FQHC flyers in [English](https://www.chicago.gov/content/dam/city/sites/covid/documents/FQHC_Flyer_En.pdf)and [Spanish](https://www.chicago.gov/content/dam/city/sites/covid/documents/FQHC_Flyer_Es.pdf). - You can also search [vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/), text your ZIP code to 438829, or call 1-800-232-0233 to find locations near you. [Vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/)is a free, online service where you can use to search for pharmacies and providers that offer vaccination. Information about where COVID-19 vaccines are available is provided directly by pharmacies and providers, in collaboration with states, and is updated daily. Call or visit your local pharmacy's website for more information on availability of the COVID-19 vaccine: In-home vaccination is available at no cost to all Chicago households, and now includes the updated COVID-19 vaccines (bivalent boosters). CDPH's in-home vaccination program offers vaccination for eligible Chicagoans, age 6 months or older. Sign up at [chicago.gov/AtHome](https://www.chicago.gov/city/en/sites/covid-19/home/at-home-vaccinations.html) or by calling [(312) 746-4835](tel:3127464835). The City of Chicago has made it easy to get vaccinated and offers COVID-19 vaccinations at various pop-up locations throughout the city and other special events. Check out the City's [Calendar of Events](https://www.chicago.gov/city/en/sites/covid19-vaccine/home/calendar-of-events.html) and find your COVID-19 vaccine in your neighborhood today. The City of Chicago operates multiple [vaccination sites](https://www.chicago.gov/city/en/sites/covid19-vaccine/home/city-sites.html) that offer initial and booster doses. Need help locating a vaccination site? Search [vaccines.gov](https://www.vaccines.gov/), text your ZIP code to 438829, or call [1.800.232.0233](tel:1-800-232-0233) to find locations near you.
